column2: English: Florence) is a municipality and capital city of the Department of Caquetá

column1: Florencia is located by the steps of the Cordillera Oriental mountain range. The municipality of Florencia limits to the north with the Huila Department and the municipality of El Paujil
column2: to the east with the municipalities of El Paujil and La Montañita
column3: to the south with the municipalities of Milán and Morelia
column4: and to the west with the municipality of Belén de Andaquies and the Huila Department.

column1: Florencia has a tropical rainforest climate (Af)
column2: and experiences significant rainfall during the course of the year. There is still a large amount of rainfall
column3: even in the driest month. The average temperature in Florencia is 19.2 °C. In Florencia
column5: while June tends to be the wettest month. About 5191 mm (around 204 inches) of precipitation falls annually during the year.
